class_notes: Birth defects are a leading cause of perinatal- and under-5 mortality and disability. Developmental disabilities contribute to impairment in physical, learning, language, and behaviors. Birth defects and developmental disabilities are common, costly, and critical. This course emphasizes current knowledge on surveillance, risk factors, care, and health policy across lifespan for individuals with birth defects and developmental disabilities. Related concepts in epidemiology, study methods, bias analysis, and effect modification will be taught. Students will receive a comprehensive understanding of birth defects and developmental disabilities epidemiology at the state, federal, and international level. There will also be guest lectures by national and international experts. Prerequisites: EPI 530, EPI 540 or EPI 539, EPI 550
